title: Jonquil (color)
text:
Jonquil is a hue of <a href="yellow">yellow</a>. It is the color of the interior of the central cylindrical tubular projection of the jonquil flower. The color takes its name from a species of plant, "<a href="Narcissus%20jonquilla">Narcissus jonquilla</a>", which has clusters of small fragrant yellow flowers, and is native to the <a href="Mediterranean%20climate">Mediterranean</a>.
The first known recorded use of jonquil as a color name in <a href="English%20language">English</a> was in 1789.
Cultural references.
<a href="Kurt%20Vonnegut">Kurt Vonnegut</a> uses the word jonquil in his novel "The Sirens of Titan", <a href="Titan%20%28moon%29">Titan</a> being the largest moon of <a href="Saturn">Saturn</a>.
